doc.field: Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church foreclosure deed
Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church foreclosure deed

One deed between Thomas M. Riley, Sheriff of Kings County, and William P. Earle of New York City, granting Earle a portion of the property occupied by the Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church due to foreclosure. The deed was created in 1880 and was recorded in the Kings County Register's Office in 1881.

One deed between Thomas M. Riley, Sheriff of Kings County, and William P. Earle of New York City, granting Earle a portion of the property occupied by the Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church due to foreclosure. The deed was created in 1880 and was recorded in the Kings County Register's Office in 1881.

One deed between Thomas M. Riley, Sheriff of Kings County, and William P. Earle of New York City, granting Earle a portion of the property occupied by the Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church due to foreclosure. The deed was created in 1880 and was recorded in the Kings County Register's Office in 1881.
The Greene Avenue Presbyterian Church was organized in 1874.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1974.
